This seems to be roughly the position of Beard–North–Price

350, taking cult offered to or for the emperor as part of a wider set of associations, which would include the image of the emperor offering sacrifice. The authors nevertheless include dedications for the emperor’s salus within imperial cult—for example, sacrifice to the Capitoline Triad for the emperor’s well-being or a taurobolium to Magna Mater for the same intention
Other examples of the pro salute formula confirm the point
